messages.text: Hi all, I’m using Gtk.jl and am trying to initialize a GtkListStore but the number of elements it needs is dependent on the data the user loads in. Any advice on how to handle this?

elements.text: Hi all, I’m using Gtk.jl and am trying to initialize a GtkListStore but the number of elements it needs is dependent on the data the user loads in. Any advice on how to handle this?

messages.text: Never mind I figured out I can use splatting to pass an array of types

elements.text: Never mind I figured out I can use splatting to pass an array of types

messages.text: This does raise another question: I have a GUI that loads a data file and displays it in a table using a list store and tree view as described in the documentation. The problem is, files can be arbitrarily large. I just tested with a file that loads in as 175 rows with 109 columns and the UI gets very laggy. Is there anything I can do about this?

elements.text: This does raise another question: I have a GUI that loads a data file and displays it in a table using a list store and tree view as described in the documentation.
